payload.description:
Every CLI command should display accumulated API spend at the bottom of output. Show spend over last hour, day, week, and month.

Implementation:
- Store request log in ~/.xc/usage.jsonl (one line per API call: timestamp, endpoint, estimated cost)
- After each command completes, read the log and display a compact footer like:
  `Cost: $0.02 (1h) · $0.15 (24h) · $0.89 (7d) · $3.40 (30d)`
- Cross-reference with GET /2/usage/tweets for official numbers when available
- Support --quiet to suppress the cost footer
- Support xc cost for a detailed breakdown
- Budget enforcement from the spec (xc budget set --daily 2.00 --action block)

State directory: ~/.xc/ (not ~/.config/xc/ — simpler)
- ~/.xc/config.json (auth + settings, migrate from ~/.config/xc/)
- ~/.xc/usage.jsonl (request log)
- ~/.xc/budget.json (budget config)
payload.title: Cost tracking: show accumulated spend after every command

payload.description:
Move config storage from ~/.config/xc/ to ~/.xc/ for simplicity. Store auth, usage log, and budget config all under ~/.xc/:
- ~/.xc/config.json (accounts + auth credentials)
- ~/.xc/usage.jsonl (per-request cost log)
- ~/.xc/budget.json (spending limits)
payload.title: Migrate config directory to ~/.xc/
